name: gnx86
tagline: gnx86 is not x86. But it is a free (as in freedom) computer, or at least a seed for one.
body:
### gnx86 is a free computer. Just not a physical one.
The goal is to make a simple, implementable, yet readable computer architecture, based on a register machine with interrupts. Free computers are necessary for GNUsers, since [the GNU freedoms must include hardware to make any sense](http://blogg.hioa.no/alfred/2013/03/03/the-gnu-freedoms-must-include-hardware-to-make-any-sense/). 

gnx86 has nothing to do with GNU, except that it considers it a friend.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
